{"step_by_step_thinking": "The oculomotor nerve, also known as cranial nerve III, is responsible for the majority of the eye's movements as well as pupil constriction and maintaining an open eyelid. It passes through the superior orbital fissure, a gap or opening in the bones of the skull located in the orbit, which is the bony socket that houses the eyeball.", "answer_choice": "B. Superior orbital fissure"}
